---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/MapKitJS/CircleOverlay
crawled: 2025-12-05T12:22:07Z
---

# CircleOverlay

**Class**

A circular overlay with a configurable radius that centers on a specific geographic coordinate.

## Declaration

```swift
class CircleOverlay extends Overlay
```

## Overview

The circle overlay provides a built-in object for creating circles. MapKit JS defines [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/CircleOverlay] by a coordinate and a radius (in meters). All [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/OverlayOptions/style] properties apply to circle overlays except `lineCap`, `lineJoin`, and `fillRule`. MapKit JS ignores properties that don’t apply.

[doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/CircleOverlay] doesn’t implement methods of its own. For more information, see the base object, [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Overlay].

The following example uses circle overlays to show the relative population sizes of three cities in the San Francisco Bay Area:

```javascript
const stats = [
    { name: "San Francisco", coordinate: [37.783333, -122.416667], population: 852469 },
    { name: "Oakland", coordinate: [37.804444, -122.270833], population: 390724 },
    { name: "San Jose", coordinate: [37.333333, -121.9], population: 1000536 },
];

const style = new mapkit.Style({
    lineWidth: 2,         // 2 CSS pixels.
    strokeColor: "#999",
    fillColor: "#FFF"
});

const circles = stats.map(function(stat) {
    const coordinate = new mapkit.Coordinate(stat.coordinate[0], stat.coordinate[1]),
        radius = stat.population / 85, // The radius is in meters.
        circle = new mapkit.CircleOverlay(coordinate, radius);
    circle.data = { population: stat.population };
    circle.style = style;
    return circle;
});

map.addOverlays(circles);
```

## Creating a circle overlay

- **new CircleOverlay(coordinate, radius, options)**: Creates a circle overlay with a center coordinate, radius, and style options.
- **OverlayOptions**: A dictionary of options that determines an overlay’s data, and indicates whether it’s visible, in an enabled state, and in a selected state.

## Defining the circle

- **coordinate**: The coordinate of the circle overlay’s center.
- **radius**: The circle overlay’s radius, in meters.

## Overlays

- **Adding interactivity to overlays**: Configure and respond to overlays to make them interactive.
- **Overlay**: An abstract base object that defines the methods and properties for map overlays.
- **Style**: A set of observable style properties for overlays, including the color and opacity of strokes and fills, and line styles.
- **PolylineOverlay**: An overlay of connected line segments that don’t form a closed shape.
- **PolygonOverlay**: An overlay consisting of one or more points that forms a closed shape.
- **OverlayOptions**: A dictionary of options that determines an overlay’s data, and indicates whether it’s visible, in an enabled state, and in a selected state.
- **TileOverlay**: An overlay that covers an area of the map with bitmapped tiles.
- **TileOverlayUrlTemplate**: A type that specifies the URL template for a tile overlay.

## Inherits From

- Overlay
